SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

edu.uw.cs.cse461.sp12.util
Class NameManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.uw.cs.cse461.sp12.util.NameManager

public class NameManager
extends java.lang.Object

Abstracts the underlying sqlite database into a set of easy-to-use- methods. Also insulates the caller from the issue that only the thread that opened the db can access the db.

The db has only one table, with fields 'name', 'rectype', and 'value'. name is a key, as is (name,rectype).

The only supported operations are 'read' and 'write'. Read returns an array containing zero or more rows. Write updates, if a record with the corresponding keys already exists. Otherwise, it inserts a new record.

Author:
zahorjan

Constructor Detail

NameManager

public NameManager(java.util.Properties config)
            throws NameManager.NameException
Constructor. Only the thread that opens the db can operate on it. The db is opened in this constructor. Therefore, you NameServer instances should be ephemeral -- create one at the start of a single-threaded sequence of operations and then discard it.

Parameters:
config -
Throws:
NameManager.NameException

readOneRecord

public NameManager.NameRecord readOneRecord(java.lang.String name,
                                            java.lang.String type)
                                     throws NameManager.NameException
Retrieves records matching the given name and type and checks that there are only 0 or 1 of them. Returns null if there is no matching record. Throws an exception if there is more than one match. Otherwise, returns the single record.

Throws:
NameManager.NameException

parentOf

public static java.lang.String parentOf(java.lang.String name)
Given a valid name, returns parent of that name. For example, given a.b.c.d, returns b.c.d. (Note that the name of the root is "").

Parameters:
name - The name whose parent you want
Returns:
The name of the parent. Returns the root ("") if argument name is null.
